title.narrative: Strengthening Reconciliation Processes in Sri Lanka (SRP)

description.narrative: 1. Baseline research; Curriculum and materials development of Tamil language teacher training course and Tamil language learning course; delivery of teacher training courses and rollout of language courses. 2. Baseline research; curriculum and materials development of master trainer course and public service translation and interpreting course; direct delivery of courses. 3. Baseline research into story-banks. Design, development, translation (3 languages) and delivery of bespoke Artsathon course. Grant disbursement to artists for product development and dissemination. Design, development and delivery of bespoke Mediation course. Media insight survey."

National Institute of Language Education and Training trainers and resource persons; master trainers; public officers. Practising public service translators and interpreters (PSTIs), public service transitional and interpreting master trainers. Artists, media personnel, wider public.

Objective 1: Supporting the reconciliation process by reducing language barriers by improving language proficiency of public officers and professional skills of language trainers. Objective 2: Supporting the reconciliation process by improving the provision of public service transition and interpreting (PSTI) to international standards. Objective 3: Supporting reconciliation by improving the provision and use of arts and media in public messaging as a tool in bringing communities together.

The overall objective of the EU Joint Action on Strengthening Reconciliation Processes in Sri Lanka is that Government, Non-Government and grassroots organisations take joint responsibility in addressing key elements of the reconciliation process. This will be achieved through two main outputs: i) more effective and accountable institutional arrangements within and between stakeholders of State and Civil Society support reconciliation process; and ii) the systematic facilitation of strategic initiatives to support the non-recurrence pillar of reconciliation (intra-communal, inter-communal and North-South). The British Council will implement the Action contributing to Output ii comprising interventions linked to two clusters of activities, which are Reducing Language Barriers promoting arts and culture for reconciliation. The Reducing Language Barriers cluster of activities support the improvement of non-discriminatory service delivery in critical areas of public service in line with the Official Languages Policy and strengthening capacities for official translator and interpreter services. The Arts for Reconciliation interventions improve the use of multiple art forms and media to engage fragmented communities to promote reconciliation.
